name: Kepler-284
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-284 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-284 is a star with 0.7050000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.81 times its radius. It is located 3466.35 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-284 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-284 b

Kepler-284 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.70 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-284.

The mass of Kepler-284 b is 6.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-284 b is 2.24 that of Earth. At 6.68 Earth masses, Kepler-284 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-284 c

Kepler-284 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 37.51 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-284.

The mass of Kepler-284 c is 9.63 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-284 c is 2.61 that of Earth. At 9.63 Earth masses, Kepler-284 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-284, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
